questions.question_text:
A project manager is working on a project with three virtual teams. Team A is in a different time zone than teams B and C. The project was going well, but recently team A has started feeling left out. Information reaches team A late or is sometimes missed, and teams B and C give preference to each other's problems over team A. The project manager has already set project guidelines, but realizes they need to be improved.

Which two things should the project manager do to help the teams collaborate better? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
AB

To help the teams collaborate better, the project manager should consider the following actions, according to PMBOK principles:

1. **Revise Communication Channels**: Review and update communication channels to ensure timely and inclusive communication among all three virtual teams. This may involve implementing new tools or adjusting communication protocols to address the time zone differences and ensure that information reaches all teams promptly.

2. **Foster Team Building Activities**: Organize virtual team building activities or workshops to strengthen relationships and foster a sense of unity among the three teams. This can help improve collaboration, build trust, and reduce feelings of isolation or exclusion experienced by team A.

By implementing these strategies, the project manager can improve collaboration and communication among the virtual teams, leading to better project outcomes.

Selected Answer: AB
According to PMI-PMP guidelines, to improve collaboration and address the issues faced by Team A, the project manager should take steps to enhance communication and ensure all teams feel included and valued. The most appropriate actions are:

A. Update the communications management plan and encourage the teams to review it promptly and proactively.

Reason: Updating the communications management plan ensures that it addresses the current communication challenges. Encouraging proactive review helps all teams understand their roles and the importance of timely and inclusive communication.
B. Schedule weekly progress meetings with all three teams and have them take turns as key players.

Reason: Weekly progress meetings with rotating key players ensure that all teams have an equal opportunity to voice their concerns and contribute. This helps in fostering a sense of inclusion and collaboration among all teams.

comments.content: No, "C" does nothing to address the collaboration component of the question.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
By updating the communications management plan, the project manager can establish clearer guidelines and processes for communication across different time zones and teams. This updated plan should outline expectations for communication frequency, methods, and protocols for sharing information. Encouraging all teams to review and adhere to this plan ensures that everyone is on the same page regarding communication practices, which can help address the issue of team A feeling left out due to delayed or missed information. Also, implementing a standardized status reporting template ensures consistent and timely updates from all teams. This template should include key progress updates, challenges, and any other relevant information that needs to be shared regularly among the teams. By sharing the template before the end of the day, team members can provide updates that will be ready and accessible for other teams when they begin their workday.

What should the project manager do to ensure a smooth start and completion of the project?

questions.question_text:
A project manager has been assigned to take over an existing software project. The project manager inherited a lean team comprised of key stakeholders, subject matter experts (SMEs), and senior developers. While reviewing the project status with the team, the project manager observes that the team seems to lack direction and enthusiasm.

What should the new project manager do?

choices.B: Use iterative life cycles involving stakeholders to enable the team to improve the product end result through successive prototypes.
choices.C: Identify all the critical stakeholders during project initiation.
choices.D: Assign one team member to one stakeholder to ensure that the responsible team member is conversant with the needs of the stakeholder.
choices.A: Add more iterative techniques to improve stakeholder learning.

questions.question_text: A project manager implementing a hybrid project is dealing with multiple stakeholders in a rapidly changing business environment. How should the project manager ensure that the needs of stakeholders are consistently met?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Use iterative life cycles involving stakeholders to enable the team to improve the product end result through successive prototype

Selected Answer: B
Iterative (agile) life cycles are composed of several iterations, which repeat one or more of the phases before proceeding to the next one. Iterative approaches can only proceed when user feedback is available to be used as the basis for initiating new cycles of development, refinement and improvement.

questions.question_text:
In an agile environment, a project is running iteration four out of six. A team member leaves the company with no replacement.

What should the project manager do?

choices.A: Ask the sponsor for an experienced team member in the company to help the project team.
choices.D: Update the issue log and refer to the resource management plan to address the situation.
choices.B: Reduce the scope of the project and inform stakeholders.
choices.C: Ask the team for extra work to fulfill the project commitment.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Update the issue log and refer to the resource management plan to address the situation
